Since aligning horizontally with the apple seems straightforward and there is little risk from the enemy (which is far away at (2,6)), I will head LEFT to begin a path toward the apple.

1.rationale:
Let’s think this through:

• We’re now at (7,3) (after our previous LEFT move). Our target remains the apple at (5,2) because its Manhattan distance is the smallest (|7–5|+|3–2| = 3).

• From (7,3) our safe neighbor cells are:
 – LEFT: (6,3) → This reduces the horizontal distance to the apple from 2 to 1 while keeping the vertical difference of 1.
 – DOWN: (7,2) → This eliminates the vertical gap (0 difference) but keeps the horizontal gap at 2.
 – UP: (7,4) would actually increase the distance.
 – RIGHT is not allowed because it would reverse into our own body (the cell behind us).

• Moving LEFT to (6,3) brings us closer to the apple by reducing the x gap. Although going DOWN is also safe (yielding a Manhattan distance of 2), going LEFT better minimizes the horizontal gap. In subsequent moves we can then head downward toward (5,2).

Thus, my decided next move is: LEFT.

1.rationale:
I’m seeing that my snake’s head is at (8,3) and my body occupies (8,4) (the “T” on the board). There aren’t any apples immediately adjacent, but my best target is the apple at (5,2) (distance: |8–5| + |3–2| = 4), with the other apples farther away. From (8,3), I can’t go UP because that would run into my own body at (8,4). The available safe moves are LEFT (to (7,3)), RIGHT (to (9,3)), or DOWN (to (8,2)). Both LEFT and DOWN bring me closer to (5,2) because LEFT decreases the x‐coordinate while DOWN decreases the y‐coordinate. 

In this situation, I prefer moving LEFT. By going LEFT to (7,3), I’ll reduce the horizontal gap to that apple. In future moves I can then direct my snake further down (or diagonally by alternating LEFT and DOWN) toward (5,2), while keeping clear of both my own body and the enemy at (2,3).

My next move is: LEFT.

1.rationale:
Let’s think this through:

• We’re now at (7,3) (after our previous LEFT move). Our target remains the apple at (5,2) because its Manhattan distance is the smallest (|7–5|+|3–2| = 3).

• From (7,3) our safe neighbor cells are:
 – LEFT: (6,3) → This reduces the horizontal distance to the apple from 2 to 1 while keeping the vertical difference of 1.
 – DOWN: (7,2) → This eliminates the vertical gap (0 difference) but keeps the horizontal gap at 2.
 – UP: (7,4) would actually increase the distance.
 – RIGHT is not allowed because it would reverse into our own body (the cell behind us).

• Moving LEFT to (6,3) brings us closer to the apple by reducing the x gap. Although going DOWN is also safe (yielding a Manhattan distance of 2), going LEFT better minimizes the horizontal gap. In subsequent moves we can then head downward toward (5,2).

Thus, my decided next move is: LEFT.

1.rationale:
I’m aiming for the apple at (5,2), which is currently only 2 steps away from our head at (6,3) (since |6–5| + |3–2| = 2).

Looking at our immediate neighboring cells from (6,3):
• If we move LEFT, we arrive at (5,3). That move gives us an immediate Manhattan distance of |5–5| + |3–2| = 1.
• If we move DOWN, we land at (6,2) which also results in |6–5| + |2–2| = 1.

Both moves are safe since neither (5,3) nor (6,2) contains any enemy snake, part of our body, or a wall. However, moving LEFT (to (5,3)) immediately aligns our x-coordinate with the apple; then in a subsequent move we can simply go DOWN into (5,2) and eat it.

Thus, my decided next move is: LEFT.

1.rationale:
Let’s analyze our options from our current head at (5,3):

• DOWN: Moving from (5,3) to (5,2) lands directly on an apple. Since (5,2) is marked with an A on the board, this would mean we immediately consume the apple, grow in length, and score a point.

• LEFT: Moving to (4,3) is safe, but it does not provide any immediate benefit (no apple) and would require extra moves to eventually reach an apple.

• UP: Going to (5,4) is also safe, but again it delays our chance to grab the apple.

• RIGHT: Moving to (6,3) would result in hitting our own tail (which is at (6,3)).

Since our objective is to gain points quickly and (5,2) contains an apple, the best move is to go DOWN.

Thus, my decided next move is: DOWN.
